byline.contributor: Kiki Zhao contributed research from Beijing.

abstract: Pile of construction debris and dirt causes landslide in Shenzhen, China, destroying structures and prompting rescue effort for survivors trapped in 15-acre mud field; incident adds to public's complaints of government corruption and lax enforcement of regulations.
lead_paragraph: At least 33 buildings are destroyed and 91 people are missing after a sea of earth struck an industrial district in the city of Shenzhen.

headline.main: Landslide Hits Southern City, Sending Hundreds Fleeing, China Reports
headline.print_headline: Landslide in China Sends Hundreds Fleeing

snippet: At least 33 buildings are destroyed and 91 people are missing after a sea of earth struck an industrial district in the city of Shenzhen.
